dhp77:1: These verbs appear to be third-person optative, not second-person imperative.
dhp78:3: A _kalyāṇa-mitta_ (lit. “beautiful friend”) is a friend who has good spiritual qualities, and who helps one develop those same good qualities.
dhp87:2: The word _bhāvetha_ is in second person, whereas the word _paṇḍito_ is third person. This indicates that they do not go together. Instead, it appears that the first part of the verse (up to _bhāvetha_) is an injunction to the listener; then from _paṇḍito_ onwards is a description of how a wise person behaves.
